snippet: The United States Marshals Service, charged with selling property taken from criminals, has what is quite likely the most varied real estate portfolio in this property-obsessed city.
abstract: Elizabeth A Harris The Appraisal column observes that United States Marshals Service, charged with selling property taken from criminals, has what is quite likely the most varied real estate portfolio in property-obsessed New York City; since January 2012, marshals in Southern District of New York have sold 28 properties for a total of $42.5 million.
lead_paragraph: The United States Marshals Service, charged with selling property taken from criminals, has what is quite likely the most varied real estate portfolio in this property-obsessed city.

headline.seo: Marshals Service’s Portfolio of Seized Properties Is Varied
headline.main: Seized Properties for Sale, But Shapes and Sizes Vary
headline.print_headline: Seized Properties for Sale, But Shapes and Sizes Vary
